responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) in Printer.printPage
    analysis: |
      The function `Printer.printPage` in `public/javascripts/printer.js` takes a `printerUrl` argument, which is intended to be the URL of a printer.
      However, this URL is included in a POST request without any validation or sanitization.
      An attacker could supply an arbitrary URL, including one pointing to an internal service on the server hosting the application, and the server would send the POST request to that URL.
      This could allow the attacker to access sensitive information or perform actions on behalf of the server.
    cwe: CWE-918
    function_names:
      - Printer.printPage
    filenames:
      - public/javascripts/printer.js
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) in Printer.printPage
leads.analysis:
The function Printer.printPage in public/javascripts/printer.js takes a printerUrl argument, which is intended to be the URL of a printer.
However, this URL is included in a POST request without any validation or sanitization.
An attacker could supply an arbitrary URL, including one pointing to an internal service on the server hosting the application, and the server would send the POST request to that URL.
This could allow the attacker to access sensitive information or perform actions on behalf of the server.
